The image was published on December 4: 2020, by a Facebook page with more than two million followers. The post has been shared more than 250 times.
The post: s caption provides information about the Catatumbo lightning phenomenon occurring over the mouth of the Catatumbo river where it empties into Lake Maracaibo in Venezuela.
Catatumbo lightning is a well: known phenomenon in Venezuela, with lightning striking the lake area for up to nine hours every day, 300 days a year. NASA has declared it the world's lightning capital.
A Google reverse image search revealed t: 2013, on a photography blog website called Night Sky Photography. The photo belongs to UK-based photographer Chris Kotsiopoulos.
